title: util : net : Download progress feature
body:
* Added a very basic progress bar for showing download progress as per issue #563, 
* A couple of tests failing but I am not sure why. 
* Three tests fail in total one of which was failing before I made the changes as well it is `tests.docs.test_swportal.TestSWPortal`, 
* The other two should pass but I am not sure why they are failing , the two tests are `tests.test_docstrings.util_net_cached_download` & `tests.test_docstrings.util_net_cached_download_unpack_archive`
* The Tracebacks above are from my local run , but they also fail in CI and look a bit different.
* **Can we use an external module in the report hook to draw the progress bar** @pdxjohnny ? As that might solve these issues as well as we would have more information like ETA , speed etc.
* The Complete Tracebacks for all the 3 failing tests are given below:
```
======================================================================
ERROR: test_readme (tests.docs.test_swportal.TestSWPortal)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/saahil/rps/gsoc2k21/dffml-stuff/dffml/dffml/util/asynctestcase.py", line 69, in run_it
    result = self.loop.run_until_complete(coro(*args, **kwargs))
  File "/home/saahil/anaconda3/envs/dffml_dev/lib/python3.7/asyncio/base_events.py", line 587, in run_until_complete
    return future.result()
  File "/home/saahil/rps/gsoc2k21/dffml-stuff/dffml/tests/docs/test_swportal.py", line 26, in test_readme
    / "swportal_consoletest_test_setup.py"
  File "/home/saahil/rps/gsoc2k21/dffml-stuff/dffml/dffml/util/testing/consoletest/cli.py", line 60, in main
    await run_nodes(args.root, args.docs, stack, nodes, setup=args.setup)
  File "/home/saahil/rps/gsoc2k21/dffml-stuff/dffml/dffml/util/testing/consoletest/runner.py", line 105, in run_nodes
    await command.run(ctx)
  File "/home/saahil/anaconda3/envs/dffml_dev/lib/python3.7/contextlib.py", line 678, in __aexit__
    raise exc_details[1]
  File "/home/saahil/anaconda3/envs/dffml_dev/lib/python3.7/contextlib.py", line 661, in __aexit__
    cb_suppress = await cb(*exc_details)
  File "/home/saahil/anaconda3/envs/dffml_dev/lib/python3.7/contextlib.py", line 552, in _exit_wrapper
    return await cm_exit(cm, exc_type, exc, tb)
  File "/home/saahil/rps/gsoc2k21/dffml-stuff/dffml/dffml/util/testing/consoletest/commands.py", line 165, in __aexit__
    os.environ["CONDA_SHLVL"] = str(int(os.environ["CONDA_SHLVL"]) - 1)
  File "/home/saahil/anaconda3/envs/dffml_dev/lib/python3.7/os.py", line 681, in __getitem__
    raise KeyError(key) from None
KeyError: 'CONDA_SHLVL'

======================================================================
ERROR: test_docstring (tests.test_docstrings.util_net_cached_download)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/saahil/rps/gsoc2k21/dffml-stuff/dffml/tests/test_docstrings.py", line 210, in testcase
    run_doctest(obj, state)
  File "/home/saahil/rps/gsoc2k21/dffml-stuff/dffml/tests/test_docstrings.py", line 179, in run_doctest
    raise Exception(output.getvalue())
Exception: **********************************************************************
File "/home/saahil/rps/gsoc2k21/dffml-stuff/dffml/dffml/util/net.py", line 155, in cached_download
Failed example:
    asyncio.run(first_line_in_manifest_152c2b())
Expected:
Downloading...: [####################################################################################################] 100.00%
    ['include', 'README.md']
Got:
Downloading...: [####################################################################################################] 100.00%
    ['include', 'README.md']


======================================================================

----------------------------------------------------------------------

  File "/home/saahil/rps/gsoc2k21/dffml-stuff/dffml/tests/test_docstrings.py", line 179, in run_doctest
    raise Exception(output.getvalue())
Exception: **********************************************************************

Failed example:
    asyncio.run(files_in_dffml_commit_c4469a())
Expected:
```

labels.name: awaiting changes
labels.description: Reviewed and awaiting changes from author

repo.name: dffml
repo.description: The easiest way to use Machine Learning. Mix and match underlying ML libraries and data set sources. Generate new datasets or modify existing ones with ease.
